sourcesContent:
import React from 'react'; const About = () => { return (

About Me

Hi, I'm Christopher Apton!

I'm currently pursuing my Master's in Applied Data Science at the University of Southern California, expected to graduate in May 2025. Before that, I earned my Bachelor’s degree in Data Theory with a minor in Bioinformatics from UCLA, graduating with a 3.7 GPA.

Outside of work and academics, I enjoy rock climbing, which has taught me perseverance, creative problem-solving, and a love for adventure. When I'm not scaling walls, I can be found building machine learning models, working on personal projects, or exploring new ways to use data to solve real-world problems.

Education

  • University of Southern California (USC), Los Angeles, CA
    MS, Applied Data Science (Expected May 2025), GPA: 3.8
  • University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA), Los Angeles, CA
    BS, Data Theory (Mathematics, Statistics, & Data Science) with a minor in Bioinformatics, GPA: 3.7

Skills

I have experience with a wide variety of programming languages, tools, and methodologies:

  • Languages: Python, R, SQL, C++, Java
  • Libraries: NumPy, Pandas, Seaborn, Scikit-learn, Keras, TensorFlow, PyTorch
  • Tools: Git, Tableau, Power BI, Jupyter Notebook, VS Code, Apache Spark
  • Certifications: Machine Learning Scientist with Python, Data Scientist Professional with Python

Professional Experience

I've had the privilege of working in diverse roles where I applied data science to solve impactful problems. Here are some highlights:

  • Data Science Research Assistant at USC's Herman Ostrow School of Dentistry
    • Designed code to process patient 3D scans for pre-trained LLM models that segment teeth.
  • Graduate Researcher at USC's Sol Price School of Public Policy
    • Leveraged LLMs to classify AI’s effects on government job roles and performed data scraping.
  • Data Science Intern at Voya Financial
    • Built a Python-based Data Quality Checker app using SQL and Snowflake.

Projects

Here are a few of the projects I'm most proud of:

  • KnowBotics (CalHacks 10.0)
    • Developed an LLM-powered homework helper bot that analyzes lecture slides, PDFs, and assignments.
  • Heart Disease Prediction
    • Built an XGBoost model with 90% validation accuracy to predict heart disease.

Hobbies

When I'm not working on data science projects, you can find me:

  • Rock climbing at local gyms and outdoor climbing spots
  • Exploring new cafes in Los Angeles
  • Participating in hackathons to solve real-world problems with innovative solutions

Contact

Feel free to reach out to me! You can connect with me via:

  • Email: chrisapton@gmail.com
  • GitHub: chrisapton
  • LinkedIn: chrisapton
); }; export default About;
